result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christopher M McClain in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Defendant Christopher M McClain in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CF15, 16CF18, 16CM17.  Agreement has been reached, court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  

15CF201-DRI
16CM17-DRI
16CF15-Ct 1-NC, court will accept and find the DE guilty -Impose/Stay 3.5 years, 18 month incarceration/24 months extended supervision/CC/DNA sample/surcharge. Concurrent to 16CF18.
               Ct 2-DRI, 

16CF18-NC- court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Impose/stay 3.5 years consisting of 18 months incarceration, 24 month extended supervision, 

Court will order 3 years probation, one year jail. Credit for 144 days.  No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession of firearms, no possession of body armour.  Restitution J/S of 3550.00 with Carissa Jordan.  Court will adopt the recommendations of the parties.  DE will be eligible for Huber for employment and counseling.  Will be eligible for SAP, CIP if revoked.

Defendant Christopher M McClain in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 15CF201 RH, 16CF15 IA, 16CF18 IA, 16CM17 MH and RH.  Sentencing hearing on revocation in case 15CF85.  15CF85 - Parties have reviewed the packet and there are no corrections or changes.  State asking for 8 mo and 4 mo with 119 days jail credit.  Yonko asking for 6 mo on ct 2 and 3 mo on ct 3 and 123 days credit.  DE speaks to the court -1:09 pm.  Court finds that the high end is appropriate in this matter.
